titleStmt.title: Joseph Hennin and Charles Dupree, Bond
CWG4546

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
we Joseph Hennin Prinicpal
Chas Dupree Security
do bind ourselves three months after date to pay The commonwealth of Ky (The plaintiff in Execution) The Sum of Four Hundred forty dollars and 41 cents with interest thereon from this date being the amount of Principal, interest and cost of an Execution 323. which issued from the clerks office of the Nelson circuit court on the 9th day of March 1862 in favor of Said commonwealth of Ky for the Sum of
Principal $400.cts
Interest 4.40
Costs 26.80
Sheriff half com 8 81
writing Bond 40
Amount $440.41 cents
Against the Said Jos Hennin and we the said Jos Hennin Principal. Chas Dupree. Security have replevied the Same
Witness. our hand and Seals this 31 day of May. 1862

attest
S S Meddis D
w Davis
Copy att Wm H Slaughter CK
uit Court
The Above bond was given on a debt Comth vs Paul Garras for forfeited Recognizance (Jos Henin being secruity in the bail bond) and principal in the Execution --
